The beds weren’t the most comfortable but no big deal. Other reviewers complained about a cat smell, it did not smell like cats. The building is old so it has an older smell to it but nothing that a little fresh air from an open window didn’t cure. I also like to bring a diffuser or candle when I take a road trip, makes me feel more at home.
Overall I would definitely recommend Julie’s place. It was a quaint, clean apartment, which is exactly what we were looking for.
We especially loved that it was right downtown!!!💕

review_text: Mary and Topher have a unique and fun property unlike any other you can stay in around New Ulm. It is in a super cool old warehouse with the most eclectic style, exciting art, quaint touches, and cozy gathering spaces for a group. The kitchen is fully stocked and we were easily able to cook and bake together for our wellness retreat weekend together. It offered the perfect amount of space for us to both be able to go off into a quiet place by ourselves when we wanted a nap or some time to read quietly. But at the same time others could be in the group spaces watching Netflix, playing board games, or just drinking coffee and laughing together. 9 of us ladies fit very comfortably into the space without feeling crowded, but rather having a sense of coziness and warmth that you wouldn't get in a hotel or conventional B and B's. We had 3 beautiful bathrooms for soaking in a bubble bath which all of us ladies took advantage of at some point in the weekend. This space would be perfect for: a girls weekend, a couple of families in town for a weekend of sports who want to have the ability to cook together or have a space to chill in between games, extended family in town over holidays who you would like to put up in a space where they aren't crammed into small hotel rooms and you can all hang out together, etc. As a resident of New Ulm for many years I am well acquainted with the other properties in town and this one is a stand-out.
